Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately draw at least two different types of habitats, such as a forest land habitat and an ocean water habitat.
The student can include a diverse array of living things in each habitat, like trees, grasses, bushes, lizards, fish, birds, and insects.
The student can show a variety of plants in each habitat, reflecting careful observations from firsthand experience or media.
The student can illustrate a wide range of animals in each habitat, accurately based on observations.
The student can effectively make comparisons and show how the types of living things differ between the land and water habitats drawn.
The student can organize their drawing to clearly demonstrate the differences in biodiversity between the habitats.
The student can identify and highlight patterns of diversity in the plants and animals illustrated in the different habitats.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally not label some plants or animals, though this does not hinder overall understanding.
The student might not perfectly proportion some living things or habitats in their drawings, but the key relationships and details are still clearly depicted.
